<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:0.65in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>6.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This Amendment shall be binding upon and inure to the benefit of the parties hereto and their respective successors and assigns.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:0.65in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>7.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This Amendment shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of Michigan.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:0.64in;text-align:justify;'><b><font SIZE=2>IN WITNESS WHEREOF</font></b><font size=2>, the undersigned have executed this Amendment as of the date written below.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:3.49in;text-align:justify;'><b><font SIZE=2>TAUBMAN REALTY GROUP,</font></b></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:3.49in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>a Delaware limited partnership</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:3.49in; text-indent:-3.49in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="241" style='margin-left:251.25pt;border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="20%" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>By:</font></p> </td>
        <td width="70%" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Taubman Centers, Inc.</font></p> </td>
        <td  width="8%">
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></td> </tr>
    <tr >
        <td width="20%" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Its:</font></p> </td>
        <td  colspan="2" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Managing General Partner</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:3.49in; text-indent:-3.49in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:3.49in; text-indent:-3.49in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

    <tr >
        <td width="16%" valign=top >

        <td width="72%" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Executive Vice President/Chief</font></p> </td>
        <td  width="11%">

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10
<SEQUENCE>5
<FILENAME>form10k04ex10d.htm
<DESCRIPTION>3RD AMENDMENT TO INCENTIVE OPTION PLAN
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE> </TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY bgcolor="#ffffff" style='font-family:"Arial"'>




<p STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;'><B><FONT SIZE=2>THIRD AMENDMENT TO THE</FONT></B></P>

<p STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;'><U><B><FONT SIZE=2>THE TAUBMAN REALTY GROUP LIMITED PARTNERSHIP 1992 INCENTIVE OPTION PLAN</FONT></B></U></P>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:center;'><b><font size=2>(As Amended and Restated Effective as of September 30, 1997)</font></b></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:center;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:0.5in;text-align:justify;'><b><font SIZE=2>WHEREAS</font></b><font size=2>, THE TAUBMAN REALTY GROUP LIMITED PARTNERSHIP (the &#147;Company&#148;) has adopted and maintains The Taubman Realty Group Limited Partnership 1992 Incentive Option Plan, as most recently amended and restated effective as of September&nbsp;30,&nbsp;1997, and as thereafter amended from time to time (the &#147;Plan&#148;); and</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:0.5in;text-align:justify;'><b><font SIZE=2>WHEREAS</font></b><font size=2>, pursuant to Section&nbsp;8.1 of the Plan, the Compensation Committee of the Board of Directors of Taubman Centers,&nbsp;Inc. (the &#147;Compensation Committee&#148;) has the authority to amend the Plan; and</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:0.5in;text-align:justify;'><b><font SIZE=2>WHEREAS</font></b><font size=2>, the Compensation Committee desires to amend the Plan to allow the Compensation Committee, in its discretion:  (1) to determine the vesting and exercise schedule of each Incentive Option under the Plan and (2) to extend the exercise period of an Incentive Option following an employee&#146;s termination of employment.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:0.5in;text-align:justify;'><b><font SIZE=2>NOW, THEREFORE</font></b><font size=2>, the Plan is hereby amended, effective as of March&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2005, as follows:</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:0.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The introductory paragraph of Section&nbsp;7.3 of the Plan is hereby amended to read as follows:</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&#147;</font><b><font size=2>7.3</font></b><font size=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><b><font size=2>Conditions for Exercise (Vesting).</font></b><font size=2>  Except as otherwise provided in this Section&nbsp;7.3 or in case of the death, Disability or Retirement of an Optionee while an Employee, and subject to the provisions of Sections&nbsp;7.6,&nbsp;8.3, and&nbsp;8.4, the Compensation Committee shall determine, in its discretion, at the Date of Grant the time at which an Incentive Option becomes exercisable (</font><i><font size=2>i.e.</font></i><font size=2> &#147;vests&#148;), which such time shall be included as one of the terms of the Option Agreement.&#148;</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="508" style='margin-left:.5in;border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="9%" valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>2.</font></p> </td>
        <td width="90%" valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Subsection&nbsp;7.3(a) of the Plan is hereby amended to read as follows:</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.5in; text-indent:0.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&#147;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Subject to paragraph (d) of this Section&nbsp;7.3, each Incentive Option granted under the Plan prior to March&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2005 (other than a Special Incentive Option) shall become exercisable:&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;on the third (3rd) anniversary date of the Date of Grant of such Incentive Option, to the extent of one-third (1/3) of the Units of Partnership Interest made subject to such Incentive Option; (ii)&nbsp;on the fourth (4th) anniversary date of the Date of Grant of such Incentive Option, to the extent of an additional one-third (1/3) of the Units of Partnership Interest made subject to such Incentive Option; and (iii)&nbsp;on the fifth (5th) anniversary date of the Date of Grant, to the extent of all of the Units of Partnership Interest made subject to such Incentive Option.&#148;</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="467" style='margin-left:.5in;border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="10%" valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>3.</font></p> </td>
        <td width="89%" valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Section&nbsp;7.7 of the Plan is hereby amended to read as follows:</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&#147;</font><b><font size=2>7.7</font></b><font size=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><b><font size=2>Termination of Employment (Except by Death, Disability, or Retirement) Before Vesting.  </font></b><font size=2>If an Optionee ceases to be an Employee for any reason other than death, Disability, or Retirement of the Optionee before the Incentive Option fully vests </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>
<br>
<HR noshade align="center" width="100%" size="2">
<p style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<pAGE>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>under the Plan, such Optionee&#146;s right to exercise the unvested portion(s) of such Incentive Option shall be forfeited immediately and permanently.&#148;</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="467" style='margin-left:.5in;border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="10%" valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>4.</font></p> </td>
        <td width="89%" valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Section&nbsp;7.8 of the Plan is hereby amended to read as follows:</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&#147;</font><b><font size=2>7.8</font></b><font size=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><b><font size=2>Termination of Employment (Except by Death, Disability, or Retirement) After Vesting.  </font></b><font size=2>If an Optionee ceases to be an Employee for any reason other than death, Disability or Retirement of an Optionee while an Employee, such Optionee shall have the right, subject to the restrictions of Sections&nbsp;7.5,&nbsp;7.17, and&nbsp;7.18 hereof, to exercise such Incentive Option under the Plan, in full or in part, at any time within ninety (90) Days after his cessation of employment, or such other period determined by the Compensation Committee in its discretion, but only to the extent that, on the date of such cessation of employment, such Optionee&#146;s right to exercise such Incentive Option, or part thereof, had vested pursuant to the terms of
Section&nbsp;7.3 hereof and the applicable Option Agreement and had not previously been exercised.&#148;</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="512" style='margin-left:.5in;border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="9%" valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>5.</font></p> </td>
        <td width="90%" valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>The following is hereby added at the end of Section 7.16 of the Plan:</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&#147;, provided that such surrender terms may not provide for any deferral of compensation.&#148;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:0.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>6.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Except as expressly set forth herein, the terms and provisions of the Plan shall continue unmodified and are hereby confirmed and ratified.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:0.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>7.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This Third Amendment shall be binding upon and inure to the benefit of the parties hereto and their respective successors and assigns.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:0.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>8.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This Third Amendment shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of Michigan.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:0.5in;text-align:justify;'><b><font SIZE=2>IN WITNESS WHEREOF</font></b><font size=2>, the undersigned has executed this Third Amendment as of the date written below.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:0.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="236" style='margin-left:3.5in;border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="90%" valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 6.0pt 0in'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font SIZE=2>TAUBMAN REALTY GROUP,</font></p>  </td>
        <td  width="9%">
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></td> </tr>
    <tr >
        <td  colspan="2" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>a Delaware limited partnership</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:center;'><font SIZE=2>THE TAUBMAN REALTY GROUP LIMITED PARTNERSHIP</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:center;'><font size=2>1992 INCENTIVE OPTION PLAN</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:center;'><u><font SIZE=2>OPTION AGREEMENT</font></u></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:center;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:0.6in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>THIS OPTION AGREEMENT, dated as of this ________ day of ________________, 20______, is entered into by and between THE TAUBMAN REALTY GROUP LIMITED PARTNERSHIP, a Delaware limited partnership(the &#147;Partnership&#148;), and ________________(the &#147;Optionee&#148;).</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0  style='margin-left:.5in;border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="9%" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>1.</font></p> </td>
        <td  valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><u><font size=2>Incorporation of Plan.</font></u><font size=2> This incentive Option is granted as of the date written above pursuant to and subject to all of the terms and conditions of The Taubman Realty Group Limited Partnership 1992 Incentive Option Plan (the &#147;Plan&#148;), the provisions of which are by reference made a part hereof to the same extent as if set forth in their entirety herein, and to such other terms and conditions as are hereinafter stated, all determinations necessary or appropriate to the grant hereof having been made. A copy of the Plan is on file in the office of the Partnership. The Optionee hereby acknowledges that he or she has received a copy of the Plan. </font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0  style='margin-left:.5in;border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="9%" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>2.</font></p> </td>
        <td  valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><u><font size=2>Grant of Incentive Option</font></u><font size=2>. Pursuant to the Plan, the Partnership hereby grants to the Optionee as of the date of this Option Agreement an Incentive Option to purchase any one or more of an aggregate of _____________ (_________) Units of Partnership Interest, subject to adjustment in accordance with Section 4.3 of the Plan. The Incentive Option will vest in accordance with the schedule attached hereto as Exhibit A. </font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0  style='margin-left:.5in;border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="9%" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>3.</font></p> </td>
        <td  valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><u><font size=2>Exercise Price.</font></u><font size=2> The price to be paid for each Unit of Partnership Interest made the subject of the Incentive Option upon the Optionee&#146;s exercise of the Incentive Option or any part thereof shall be the Exercise Price of $_____________ per Unit of Partnership Interest. </font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0  style='margin-left:.5in;border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="9%" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>4.</font></p> </td>
        <td  valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><u><font size=2>Exercise of Incentive Option</font></u><b><font size=2>.</font></b><font size=2> The Incentive Option, to the extent exercisable, may be exercised as provided in the Plan and by delivering to the Partnership (i) a written notice of exercise in substantially the form prescribed from time to time by the Compensation Committee and (ii) full payment in cash of the Exercise Price times the total number of Units of Partnership Interest purchased under the Incentive Option. Such notice shall specify the number of Units of Partnership Interest with respect to which the Incentive Option is being exercised and shall be signed by the Person exercising the Incentive Option. If the Incentive Option is exercised by a Person other than the Optionee, such notice shall be accompanied by proof, satisfactory to the Partnership, of such Person&#146;s right to exercise the
Incentive Option. </font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0  style='margin-left:.5in;border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="9%" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>5.</font></p> </td>
        <td  valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><u><font size=2>Nontransferability of Incentive Option</font></u><font size=2>. The Optionee&#146;s rights and Interests under the Plan and this Option Agreement shall not be assignable or transferable other than to a Family Trust or by will or the laws of descent and distribution, and, during the Optionee&#146;s lifetime, only the Optionee personally (or the Optionee&#146;s guardian or other legal representative) or the trustee of a Family Trust with respect to the Optionee may exercise the Optionee&#146;s rights under the Plan and this Option Agreement. An Optionee&#146;s Beneficiary may exercise the Optionee&#146;s rights to the extent they are exercisable under the Plan following the death of the Optionee. </font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0  style='margin-left:.5in;border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="9%" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>6.</font></p> </td>
        <td  valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><u><font size=2>Rights as an Employee</font></u><font size=2>. The grant of the Incentive Option pursuant to the Plan and this Option Agreement shall not in any way be deemed to constitute a contract of employment between the Manager or a Manager Entity or the Partnership or the Company and the Optionee or any other Person; nor shall the Plan or this Agreement be construed to give the Optionee or any other Person the right to remain in the employment of the Manager or a Manager Entity or to affect the right of the Manager or a Manager Entity to terminate the Optionee&#146;s or such other Person&#146;s employment at any time with or without cause, it </font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>
<br>
<HR noshade align="center" width="100%" size="2">
<p style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<pAGE>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:1in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>being acknowledged, unless expressly provided otherwise in writing, that the Optionee&#146;s or such other Person&#146;s employment is &#147;at will&#148;.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0  style='margin-left:.5in;border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="9%" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>7.</font></p> </td>
        <td  valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><u><font size=2>Notices</font></u><font size=2>. Any notice to the Partnership contemplated by the Agreement shall be addressed to the Compensation Committee of the Partnership, in care of the Manager, at 200 East Long Lake Road, Suite 200, Bloomfield Hills, Michigan 48303; and any notice to the Optionee shall be addressed to him or her at the address on file with the Manager on the date hereof or at such other address as he or she may hereafter designate in writing. </font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0  style='margin-left:.5in;border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="9%" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>8.</font></p> </td>
        <td  valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><u><font size=2>Interpretation</font></u><font size=2>. The interpretation, construction, performance, and enforcement of this Option Agreement and of the Plan shall lie within the sole discretion of the Partnership, and the Partnership&#146;s determinations shall be conclusive and binding on all interested Persons. In the event of any inconsistency between any provision of the Plan and any provision of this Option Agreement, the provision of the Plan shall govern. </font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0  style='margin-left:.5in;border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="9%" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>9.</font></p> </td>
        <td  valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><u><font size=2>Amendment</font></u><font size=2>. The Compensation Committee may from time to time amend this Option Agreement to the extent the Committee deems necessary for the purpose of attaining or preserving consistency with the terms and provisions of the Plan and the Continuing Offer, or as permitted by the Plan, and in such manner as the Compensation Committee deems equitable or as may be required pursuant to applicable law. </font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:0.61in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>IN WITNESS WHEREOF, each of the parties hereto has executed this Option Agreement, and in the case of the Partnership by its duly authorized officer, as of the day and year first above written. </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

    <tr >
        <td width="60%" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font SIZE=2>OPTIONEE: </font></p> </td>
        <td  colspan="3" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font SIZE=2>THE TAUBMAN REALTY GROUP</font></p> </td> </tr>
    <tr >
        <td  width="60%">
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></td>
        <td width="29%" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font SIZE=2>LIMITED PARTERSHIP, </font></p> </td>
        <td   colspan="2">
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></td> </tr>
    <tr >
        <td  width="60%">
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></td>
        <td  colspan="2" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>a Delaware limited partnership</font></p> </td>
        <td  width="6%">
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></td> </tr>
    <tr>
        <td width="336" ></td>

        <td width="163" ></td>

        <td width="21" ></td>

        <td width="39" ></td> </tr> </table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="589" style='border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="57%" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>___________________________________</font></p> </td>
        <td width="42%" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>By:________________________________</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="509" style='border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="68%" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>By: _______________________________</font></p> </td>
        <td width="31%" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Its:  Authorized Signatory </font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10
<SEQUENCE>7
<FILENAME>form10k04ex10m.htm
<DESCRIPTION>1ST AMENDMENT TO COMPENSATION PLAN
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE> </TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY bgcolor="#ffffff" style='font-family:"Arial"'>




<p STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;'><B><FONT SIZE=2>FIRST AMENDMENT TO THE</FONT></B></P>

<p STYLE=' MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;'><U><B><FONT SIZE=2>THE TAUBMAN COMPANY LONG-TERM PERFORMANCE COMPENSATION PLAN</FONT></B></U></P>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:center;'><b><font size=2>(As Amended and Restated Effective January</font></b><font size=2>&nbsp;</font><b><font size=2>1,</font></b><font size=2>&nbsp;</font><b><font size=2>2000)</font></b></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:center;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:0.5in;text-align:justify;'><b><font SIZE=2>WHEREAS</font></b><font size=2>, THE TAUBMAN COMPANY&nbsp;LLC (formerly The Taubman Company Limited Partnership) (the &#147;Company&#148;) has adopted and maintains The Taubman Company Long-Term Performance Compensation Plan, as most recently amended and restated effective January&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2000 (the &#147;Plan&#148;); and</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:0.5in;text-align:justify;'><b><font SIZE=2>WHEREAS</font></b><font size=2>, pursuant to Section&nbsp;7.1 of the Plan, the Compensation Committee of the Board of Directors of Taubman Centers,&nbsp;Inc. (the &#147;Compensation Committee&#148;) has the authority to amend the Plan; and</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:0.5in;text-align:justify;'><b><font SIZE=2>WHEREAS</font></b><font size=2>, the Compensation Committee desires to amend the Plan, effective as of January&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2005, to comply with new provisions in the law enacted as Section&nbsp;409A of the Internal Revenue Code of&nbsp;1986, as amended, with respect to awards granted under the Plan that were not vested as of December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2004, and to make certain other miscellaneous changes.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:0.5in;text-align:justify;'><b><font SIZE=2>NOW, THEREFORE</font></b><font size=2>, the Plan is hereby amended as follows:</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="508" style='margin-left:.5in;border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="9%" valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>1.</font></p> </td>
        <td width="90%" valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>A new Section&nbsp;2.8A is hereby added to the Plan, reading as follows:</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&#147;</font><b><font size=2>2.8A</font></b><font size=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><b><font size=2>  </font></b><font size=2>Notwithstanding the above, for any 409A Award &#145;</font><b><font size=2>Change of Control Event</font></b><font size=2>&#146; means either:</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:1in; text-indent:0.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>(a)  a majority of the Board of Directors is replaced during a 12-month period by directors whose appointment or election was not approved by a vote of at least 50% of the directors comprising the Board of Directors on the date immediately preceding the removal or election; or</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:1in; text-indent:0.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>(b)  the acquisition by any person or more than one person acting as a group other than A.&nbsp;Alfred&nbsp;Taubman or any of his immediate family members or lineal descendants, any heir of the foregoing, any trust for the benefit of any of the foregoing, any private charitable foundation, or any partnership, limited liability company, or corporation owned or controlled by some or all of the foregoing, of ownership of 50% or more of the total fair market value or total voting power of the outstanding voting capital stock of TCO.&#148;</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="475" style='margin-left:.5in;border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="10%" valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>2.</font></p> </td>
        <td width="89%" valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Section&nbsp;2.11 of the Plan is hereby amended to read as follows:</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&#147;</font><b><font size=2>2.11</font></b><font size=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#145;</font><b><font size=2>Company</font></b><font size=2>&#146; means The Taubman Company&nbsp;LLC, a Delaware limited liability company, and any successor interest to the business of The Taubman Company&nbsp;LLC that has, by agreement, adopted the Plan.&#148;</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="517" style='margin-left:.5in;border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="9%" valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>3.</font></p> </td>
        <td width="90%" valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>A new Section&nbsp;2.17A is hereby added to the Plan, reading as follows:</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&#147;</font><b><font size=2>2.17A</font></b><font size=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><b><font size=2>     </font></b><font size=2>Notwithstanding the above, for any 409A Award &#145;</font><b><font size=2>Disability</font></b><font size=2>&#146; or &#145;</font><b><font size=2>Disabled</font></b><font size=2>&#146; means an Employee&#146;s physical or mental condition resulting from any medically determinable physical or mental impairment that renders such Employee incapable of engaging in </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>
<br>
<HR noshade align="center" width="100%" size="2">
<p style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<pAGE>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>any substantial gainful employment and that can be expected to result in death or that has lasted or can be expected to last for a continuous period of not less than three-hundred sixty-five (365) Days.  </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>The Disability of an Employee and the date on which an Employee ceases to be employed by reason of Disability shall be determined by the Company, in accordance with uniform principles consistently applied, upon the basis of such evidence as the Compensation Committee and the Company deem necessary and desirable, and its good faith determination shall be conclusive for all purposes of this Plan.  The Compensation Committee or the Company shall have the right to require an Employee to submit to an examination by a physician or physicians and to submit to such reexaminations as the Compensation Committee or the Company shall require in order to make a determination concerning the Employee&#146;s physical or mental condition; provided, however, that:&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;an Employee may not be required to undergo a medical examination more often than once each one-hundred eighty (180) Days, nor
at any time after the normal date of the Employee&#146;s Retirement; and (b)&nbsp;the fees and expenses of any such medical examination(s) shall be considered expenses of administering the Plan.  If any Employee engages in any occupation or employment (except for rehabilitation as determined by the Compensation Committee, on the recommendation of the Company) for remuneration or profit, which activity would be inconsistent with the finding of Disability, or if the Compensation Committee, on the recommendation of the Company, determines on the basis of a medical examination that an Employee no longer has a Disability, or if an Employee refuses to submit to any medical examination properly requested by the Compensation Committee or the Company, then in any such event, the Employee shall be deemed to have recovered from such Disability.&#148;</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="517" style='margin-left:.5in;border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="9%" valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>4.</font></p> </td>
        <td width="90%" valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>A new Section&nbsp;2.32A is hereby added to the Plan, reading as follows:</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&#147;</font><b><font size=2>2.32A   </font></b><font size=2>Notwithstanding the above, for any 409A Award &#145;</font><b><font size=2>Retirement</font></b><font size=2>&#146; means the termination of employment by an Employee after the attainment of age sixty-two (62) or upon such earlier date as required by local law.&#148;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:0.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>5.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A new Section&nbsp;2.35 is hereby added to the Plan, reading as follows, and the subsequent sections of Article&nbsp;2 are hereby renumbered accordingly:</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&#147;</font><b><font size=2>2.35</font></b><font size=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#145;</font><b><font size=2>Termination</font></b><font size=2>&#146; or &#145;</font><b><font size=2>Terminates</font></b><font size=2>,&#146; for 409A Awards only, means the termination of an Employee&#146;s employment with the Company and with all members of the Company&#146;s controlled group, as described under the aggregation rules of Code Section&nbsp;409A and any associated Internal Revenue Service guidance, and shall include a termination for any reason or no reason.&#148;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:0.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>6.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;All instances of the word &#147;termination&#148; in the Plan, with respect to 409A Awards only, as the word refers to the termination of an Employee&#146;s employment as defined in Section&nbsp;2.35 of the Plan, are hereby capitalized.</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="507" style='margin-left:.5in;border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="9%" valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>7.</font></p> </td>
        <td width="90%" valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>A new Section&nbsp;2.41 is hereby added to the Plan, reading as follows:</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&#147;</font><b><font size=2>2.41</font></b><font size=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#145;</font><b><font size=2>409A Award</font></b><font size=2>&#146; means any Award that was not vested on December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2004, and is therefore subject to the nonqualified deferred compensation requirements of Section&nbsp;409A of the Code, as enacted on October&nbsp;3,&nbsp;2004, as part of the American Jobs Creation Act of 2004.&#148;</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="467" style='margin-left:.5in;border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="10%" valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>8.</font></p> </td>
        <td width="89%" valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Section&nbsp;5.6 of the Plan is hereby amended to read as follows:</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:center;'><font size=2>2</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:center;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>
<br>
<HR noshade align="center" width="100%" size="2">
<p style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<pAGE>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&#147;</font><b><font size=2>5.6</font></b><font size=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><b><font size=2>Acceleration of Vesting.</font></b><font size=2>  Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in the Plan, including Section&nbsp;5.4 hereof, the Compensation Committee, in its discretion, upon the recommendation of the Company, may accelerate at any time the vesting of an Award that has not previously become vested, except that for 409A Awards, payment will not be made before Termination.&#148;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:0.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>9.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A new Section&nbsp;6.5A is hereby added to the Plan, reading as follows, and any cross references to Section&nbsp;6.5 in the Plan shall also include Section&nbsp;6.5A:</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&#147;</font><b><font size=2>6.5A</font></b><font size=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><b><font size=2>Time and Manner of Payment.</font></b><font size=2>  Notwithstanding the above, as soon as administratively practicable following the Settlement Date for a 409A Award Sub Account of a Participant, but no later than two (2) months following the Vesting Date, the Company shall pay to the Participant the Payout Value of such Sub Account (which will be the same as the Vesting Date Value if the Sub Account is not deferred).  Payment to the Participant of the Payout Value shall be made in cash in a lump sum.  Any and all amounts due under the Plan shall be the sole obligation of the Company, and neither TRG nor TCO shall have any liability to Participants or Beneficiaries under this Plan.&#148;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:0.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>10.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A new Section&nbsp;6.6A is hereby added to the Plan, reading as follows, and any cross references to Section&nbsp;6.6 in the Plan shall also include Section&nbsp;6.6A:</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="261" style='margin-left:1.0in;border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="18%" valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>&#147;</font><b><font size=2>6.6A</font></b></p> </td>
        <td width="81%" valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><b><font size=2>Deferral of Settlement Date.</font></b></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>Notwithstanding the above, for any 409A Award, the following deferral rules apply:</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:1in; text-indent:0.5in;text-align:justify;'><b><font size=2>(a)</font></b><font size=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><b><font size=2>Deferral for One to Five Years</font></b></u><b><font size=2>.</font></b><font size=2>  Subject to the provisions of Section&nbsp;7.2 of the Plan, each Participant may make, with respect to each 409A Award (</font><i><font size=2>i.e.,</font></i><font size=2> the Sub Account established in respect of such 409A Award), an election to defer the Settlement Date that would otherwise occur on the Vesting Date of such 409A Award.  A Participant can elect to defer until the earlier of (i)&nbsp;the January 1st which is one to five (1 - 5) years after the Vesting Date of such 409A Award; and (ii)&nbsp;the date on which the Participant&#146;s employment with the Company Terminates for any reason; provided, however, that in the case of a key employee (as defined in
Section&nbsp;416(i) of the Internal Revenue Code), distributions made on account of Termination may not be made earlier than six&nbsp;(6) months following Termination, or if earlier, the death of the Participant.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:1in; text-indent:0.5in;text-align:justify;'><b><font size=2>(b)</font></b><font size=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><b><font size=2>Deferral Beyond Five Years</font></b></u><b><font size=2>.</font></b><font size=2>  Provided the Company has received advice of its counsel that such an election would not cause the Plan to become subject to the nondiscrimination, funding, and fiduciary provisions of the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of&nbsp;1974, as amended, any Participant whose total cash compensation (paid in the previous calendar year) determined as of the date on which the deferral election is made, exceeds $120,000 (or such other amount as counsel to the Company may advise from time to time) may, in lieu of deferring the Settlement Date for the aforementioned one to five year period, make an election to defer the Settlement Date for a 409A Award until the earlier of (i)&nbsp;any
January 1st selected by the Employee at the time of such deferral election; and (ii)&nbsp;the date on which the Participant&#146;s employment with the Company Terminates for any reason; provided, however, that in the case of a key employee (as defined in Section&nbsp;416(i) of the Internal Revenue Code), distributions made on account of Termination may not be made earlier than six&nbsp;(6) months following Termination, or if earlier, the death of the Participant.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:center;'><font size=2>3</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:center;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>
<br>
<HR noshade align="center" width="100%" size="2">
<p style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<pAGE>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:1in; text-indent:0.5in;text-align:justify;'><b><font size=2>(c)</font></b><font size=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><b><font size=2>Election to Divide Sub Account in Half</font></b></u><b><font size=2>.</font></b><font size=2>  A Participant may also elect to divide a Sub Account in half and receive 50% of his Sub Account (rounded up to the nearest whole dollar) as soon as administratively practicable following the Vesting Date of such Sub Account.  The remaining 50% of the Participant&#146;s vested Sub Account shall be deferred until the Settlement Date elected pursuant to a valid deferral election under this Section&nbsp;6.6A.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:1in; text-indent:0.5in;text-align:justify;'><b><font size=2>(d)</font></b><font size=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><b><font size=2>Deadline for Deferral Election</font></b></u><b><font size=2>.</font></b><font size=2>  Any election by a Participant to defer the Settlement Date for a Sub Account pursuant to this Section&nbsp;6.6A must be made in the calendar year prior to the calendar year in which the Vesting Date for such Sub Account occurs.  An election to defer the Settlement Date for a Sub Account shall become irrevocable on the December&nbsp;31st prior to the Vesting Date for such Sub Account.&#148;</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="508" style='margin-left:.5in;border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="9%" valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>11.</font></p> </td>
        <td width="90%" valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>A new Section&nbsp;6.7A is hereby added to the Plan, reading as follows:</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&#147;</font><b><font size=2>6.7A</font></b><font size=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><b><font size=2>Early Termination of Deferral Period.</font></b><font size=2>  Notwithstanding the above, for any 409A Award, any Deferral Period elected pursuant to Section&nbsp;6.6A hereof shall terminate immediately on the occurrence of either the Termination of the employment of the Participant for any reason or a Change of Control Event.  Any 409A Award Sub Accounts that a Participant has elected to defer shall be valued as of the Settlement Date in accordance with Section&nbsp;6.1,&nbsp;6.2, or&nbsp;6.3, as applicable, and shall be distributed in a lump sum payment within two (2) months following the termination of the Deferral Period.&#148;</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="467" style='margin-left:.5in;border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="10%" valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>12.</font></p> </td>
        <td width="89%" valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Section&nbsp;7.2 of the Plan is hereby amended to read as follows:</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&#147;</font><b><font size=2>7.2</font></b><font size=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><b><font size=2>Termination of the Plan.</font></b><font size=2>  The Compensation Committee shall have the right and power to terminate the Plan at any time, and no Award shall be granted under the Plan after such termination.  Upon termination of the Plan by the Compensation Committee, no further deferral elections pursuant to Section&nbsp;6.6 or Section&nbsp;6.6A shall be permitted unless the Compensation Committee specifically provides otherwise.  In connection with any termination of the Plan pursuant to this Section&nbsp;7.2, the Compensation Committee may, in its sole discretion, cause all existing Deferral Periods for Sub Accounts then outstanding under the Plan, other than those for 409A Awards, to also terminate, thereby accelerating the Settlement Date for such Sub Accounts.
Subject to the Compensation Committee's authority to terminate all existing Deferral Periods, other than those for 409A Awards, upon termination of the Plan, any Awards outstanding at the time of termination of the Plan shall vest and become payable to the same extent and subject to the same terms and conditions, as provided in Article&nbsp;6 hereof, that would have applied to such Award if the Plan had not been terminated.&#148;</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="467" style='margin-left:.5in;border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="10%" valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>13.</font></p> </td>
        <td width="89%" valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Section 7.3 of the Plan is hereby amended to read as follows:</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&#147;</font><b><font size=2>7.3</font></b><font size=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><b><font size=2>Dissolution of TRG.</font></b><font size=2>  The dissolution of TRG (provided that TRG is not reconstituted as provided in the Partnership Agreement) shall cause the Plan to terminate immediately without any further action on the part of the Compensation Committee, and each outstanding Sub Account which is not then vested to vest immediately and fully.  In addition, the dissolution of TRG shall cause all existing Deferral Periods for Sub Accounts then outstanding under the Plan, other than those for 409A Awards, to terminate immediately, thereby accelerating the occurrence of the Settlement Date for each such Sub Account.  Upon the dissolution of TRG, each Participant shall be paid the aggregate Payout Value of his or her Sub Accounts, other than those for 409A Awards, as
provided in Article 6 hereof.  409A Awards shall be paid as if no dissolution had occurred.  The grant of any Awards pursuant to the Plan shall not affect in any </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:center;'><font size=2>4</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:center;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>
<br>
<HR noshade align="center" width="100%" size="2">
<p style='page-break-before:always'></p>
<pAGE>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>way the right or power of the Company or TRG to make changes to its business structure, or to merge, dissolve, or terminate, or to sell or transfer any or all of its assets.  Any deferral elections made by a Participant pursuant to Section&nbsp;6.6 of the Plan will be left intact.&#148;</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="508" style='margin-left:.5in;border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="9%" valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>14.</font></p> </td>
        <td width="90%" valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 12.0pt 0in'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>A new Section 7.4A is hereby added to the Plan, reading as follows:</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:1in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&#147;</font><b><font size=2>7.4A</font></b><font size=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><b><font size=2>Termination of Management Contract/Change of Control Event.</font></b><font size=2>  Notwithstanding the above, for 409A Awards only, upon the termination of the Master Services Agreement (as defined in the Partnership Agreement) between TRG and the Company, for any reason, without a renewal of such Master Services Agreement, or upon the occurrence of a Change of Control Event, the Plan shall terminate immediately, without any further action on the part of the Compensation Committee, and each outstanding 409A Award Sub Account which is not then vested shall vest immediately and fully.  On the occurrence of a Change of Control Event only, all existing Deferral Periods for 409A Award Sub Accounts then outstanding under the Plan shall terminate immediately, thereby accelerating the
Settlement Date for such Sub Accounts; and each Participant shall be paid the aggregate Payout Value of his or her Sub Accounts as provided in Article 6 of the Plan.  Upon the termination of the Master Services Agreement, however, Deferral Periods for 409A Award Sub Accounts will not terminate, and such 409A Awards will be paid as if the termination of the Master Services Agreement had not occurred.&#148;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:0.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>15.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Except as expressly set forth herein, the terms and provisions of the Plan shall continue unmodified and are hereby confirmed and ratified.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:0.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>16.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This First Amendment shall be binding upon and inure to the benefit of the parties hereto and their respective successors and assigns.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:0.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>17.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This First Amendment shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of Michigan.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:12pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:0.5in;text-align:justify;'><b><font SIZE=2>IN WITNESS WHEREOF</font></b><font size=2>, the undersigned has executed this First Amendment as of the date written below.</font></p>

    <tr style='height:.3in'>
        <td width="48%" style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:.3in'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Willow Bend Shopping Center Limited Partnership   </font></p> </td>
        <td width="18%" style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:.3in'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:center;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Delaware</font></p> </td>
        <td width="33%" style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:.3in'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>The Shops at Willow Bend</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>         </font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font></p>

over financial reporting as of December 31, 2004 and the effectiveness of internal control over financial reporting as of December 31, 2004, which reports appear in the December 31, 2004 annual report on Form 10-K of Taubman Centers, Inc.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:0.64in;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><font size=2>The undersigned, a Director of Taubman Centers, Inc., a Michigan corporation (the "</font><u><font size=2>Company</font></u><font size=2>"), does hereby constitute and appoint Robert S. Taubman and Lisa A. Payne and each of them, with full power of substitution, as his true and lawful attorney and agent to execute in his name and on his behalf, as a Director of the Company, the Company's Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2004, and any and all amendments thereto, to be filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission (the "</font><u><font size=2>Commission</font></u><font size=2>") pursuant to the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the "</font><u><font size=2>Act</font></u><font size=2>"), and any and all instruments that such attorneys and agents, or either of them, may deem necessary or advisable to enable the Company to comply with
the Act and the rules, regulations, and requirements of the Commission.  The undersigned does hereby ratify and confirm as his own act and deed all that such attorneys and agents, and each of them, shall do or cause to be done by virtue hereof.  Each such attorney or agent shall have, and may exercise, all of the powers hereby conferred.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:0.64in;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><b><font SIZE=2>IN WITNESS WHEREOF,</font></b><font size=2> the undersigned has hereunto subscribed his signature this 4</font><sup><font size=2>th</font></sup><font size=2> day of March, 2005.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:0.64in;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><font size=2>The undersigned, a Director of Taubman Centers, Inc., a Michigan corporation (the "</font><u><font size=2>Company</font></u><font size=2>"), does hereby constitute and appoint Robert S. Taubman and Lisa A. Payne and each of them, with full power of substitution, as his true and lawful attorney and agent to execute in his name and on his behalf, as a Director of the Company, the Company's Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2004, and any and all amendments thereto, to be filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission (the "</font><u><font size=2>Commission</font></u><font size=2>") pursuant to the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the "</font><u><font size=2>Act</font></u><font size=2>"), and any and all instruments that such attorneys and agents, or either of them, may deem necessary or advisable to enable the Company to comply with
the Act and the rules, regulations, and requirements of the Commission.  The undersigned does hereby ratify and confirm as his own act and deed all that such attorneys and agents, and each of them, shall do or cause to be done by virtue hereof.  Each such attorney or agent shall have, and may exercise, all of the powers hereby conferred.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:0.64in;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><b><font SIZE=2>IN WITNESS WHEREOF, </font></b><font size=2>the undersigned has hereunto subscribed his signature this 28th day of February, 2005.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:3.5in;text-align:justify;'><u><font size=2>/s/ Peter Karmanos, Jr.</font></u><font size=1></font><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="151" style='margin-left:3.5in;border-collapse:collapse'>

        <td width="100%" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Peter Karmanos, Jr.</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:center;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:center;'><b><font size=2>Certification of Chief Executive Officer</font></b></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:center;'><b><font size=2>Pursuant to 15 U.S.C. Section 10A, as Adopted Pursuant to</font></b></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>I, Robert S. Taubman, certify that:</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>I have reviewed this annual report on Form 10-K of Taubman Centers, Inc.;</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

    <tr >

            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Based on my knowledge, this annual report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this report; </font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.5in; text-indent:-0.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

        <td  valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Designed such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material information relating to the registrant, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this report is being prepared;</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.5in; text-indent:-0.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>All significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control over financial reporting, which are reasonably likely to adversely affect the registrant's ability to record, process, summarize, and report financial information; and </font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:1in; text-indent:-1in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>The registrant's other certifying officer(s) and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the registrant's auditors and the audit committee of the registrant's board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent functions):</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.5in; text-indent:-0.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0  style='margin-left:.5in;border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="8%" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>a)</font></p> </td>
        <td  valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>All significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control over financial reporting, which are reasonably likely to adversely affect the registrant's ability to record, process, summarize, and report financial information; and </font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:1in; text-indent:-1in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0  style='margin-left:.5in;border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="8%" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>b)</font></p> </td>
        <td  valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Any fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant role in the registrant's internal control over financial reporting.</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<!-- MARKER FORMAT-SHEET="Para (List) Hang Lv 0-Arial" FSL="Workstation" -->
<TABLE WIDTH=100% CELLPADDING=0 CELLSPACING=0 BORDER=0>
<TR VALIGN=TOP>
<TD WIDTH=5%><FONT FACE="Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif" SIZE=1>(a) </FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH=95%><FONT FACE="Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif" SIZE=1>Includes the impact of interest rate swaps but does not include
effect of amortization of debt issuance costs,
losses on settlement of derivatives used to hedge the refinancing of certain fixed rate debt, or interest rate cap premiums. </FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<!-- MARKER FORMAT-SHEET="Para (List) Hang Lv 0-Arial" FSL="Workstation" -->
<TABLE WIDTH=100% CELLPADDING=0 CELLSPACING=0 BORDER=0>
<TR VALIGN=TOP>
<TD WIDTH=5%><FONT FACE="Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif" SIZE=1>(b) </FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH=95%><FONT FACE="Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif" SIZE=1>Debt is reduced by $0.5 million of purchase accounting discount from
acquisition which increases the stated rate on the debt of 4.21% to an effective rate of 4.38%. </FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<!-- MARKER FORMAT-SHEET="Para (List) Hang Lv 0-Arial" FSL="Workstation" -->
<TABLE WIDTH=100% CELLPADDING=0 CELLSPACING=0 BORDER=0>
<TR VALIGN=TOP>
<TD WIDTH=5%><FONT FACE="Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif" SIZE=1>(c) </FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH=95%><FONT FACE="Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif" SIZE=1>Debt includes $4.3 million of purchase accounting premium from
acquisition which reduces the stated rate on the debt of 7.59% to an effective rate of 6.85%.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<!-- MARKER FORMAT-SHEET="Para (List) Hang Lv 0-Arial" FSL="Workstation" -->
<TABLE WIDTH=100% CELLPADDING=0 CELLSPACING=0 BORDER=0>
<TR VALIGN=TOP>
<TD WIDTH=5%><FONT FACE="Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif" SIZE=1>(d) </FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH=95%><FONT FACE="Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif" SIZE=1>The debt is floating month to month at LIBOR plus spread and the entire debt
balance is capped at 7% plus spread. </FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<!-- MARKER FORMAT-SHEET="Para (List) Hang Lv 0-Arial" FSL="Workstation" -->
<TABLE WIDTH=100% CELLPADDING=0 CELLSPACING=0 BORDER=0>
<TR VALIGN=TOP>
<TD WIDTH=5%><FONT FACE="Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif" SIZE=1>(e) </FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH=95%><FONT FACE="Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif" SIZE=1>LIBOR rate floats month to month.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<!-- MARKER FORMAT-SHEET="Para (List) Hang Lv 0-Arial" FSL="Workstation" -->
<TABLE WIDTH=100% CELLPADDING=0 CELLSPACING=0 BORDER=0>
<TR VALIGN=TOP>
<TD WIDTH=5%><FONT FACE="Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif" SIZE=1>(f) </FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH=95%><FONT FACE="Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif" SIZE=1>$100 million of this debt is swapped to 5.25% plus spread to May 2005.
The remainder is floating month to month at LIBOR plus spread.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<!-- MARKER FORMAT-SHEET="Para (List) Hang Lv 0-Arial" FSL="Workstation" -->
<TABLE WIDTH=100% CELLPADDING=0 CELLSPACING=0 BORDER=0>
<TR VALIGN=TOP>
<TD WIDTH=5%><FONT FACE="Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif" SIZE=1>(g) </FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH=95%><FONT FACE="Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif" SIZE=1>LIBOR rate is floating month to month.  $96.9 million of this debt is
capped at 4.6% plus spread to July 2006. </FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<!-- MARKER FORMAT-SHEET="Para (List) Hang Lv 0-Arial" FSL="Workstation" -->
<TABLE WIDTH=100% CELLPADDING=0 CELLSPACING=0 BORDER=0>
<TR VALIGN=TOP>

<TD WIDTH=95%><FONT FACE="Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif" SIZE=1>LIBOR rate is floating month to month.
$48.5 million of this debt is capped at 5.75% plus spread to July 2006. </FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<!-- MARKER FORMAT-SHEET="Para (List) Hang Lv 0-Arial" FSL="Workstation" -->
<TABLE WIDTH=100% CELLPADDING=0 CELLSPACING=0 BORDER=0>
<TR VALIGN=TOP>

<TD WIDTH=95%><FONT FACE="Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif" SIZE=1>Rate floats daily. </FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<!-- MARKER FORMAT-SHEET="Para (List) Hang Lv 0-Arial" FSL="Workstation" -->
<TABLE WIDTH=100% CELLPADDING=0 CELLSPACING=0 BORDER=0>
<TR VALIGN=TOP>
<TD WIDTH=5%><FONT FACE="Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif" SIZE=1>(j) </FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH=95%><FONT FACE="Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif" SIZE=1>If construction commences prior to 12/31/05, the maturity date is
automatically extended from 12/31/05 to three years from the commencement of construction. </FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<!-- MARKER FORMAT-SHEET="Para (List) Hang Lv 0-Arial" FSL="Workstation" -->

<TD WIDTH=95%><FONT FACE="Arial, Helvetica, Sans-Serif" SIZE=1> Maturity date may be extended for a total of 3 years.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<!-- MARKER FORMAT-SHEET="Para (List) Hang Lv 0-Arial" FSL="Workstation" -->
